description: This notification is generated when the system
enters or leaves the Overload state. The number
of times this has been generated and cleared is kept
track of by isisSysStatLSPDbaseOloads.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisDatabaseOverload DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisSysLevelOverloadState i 1

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: The Overload state of the database at this level.
The value 'overloaded' indicates a database that is
low on an essential resource, such as memory.
The administrator may indirectly force the state to
'waiting' when the router is initializing by setting
the object isisSysLevelSetOverload.
If the state is waiting or overloaded, we
originate LSPs with the Overload bit set.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisSysLevelOverloadState

description: This notification is generated when one of the
manual areaAddresses assigned to this system is
ignored when computing routes. The object
isisNotificationAreaAddress describes the area that
has been dropped.
The number of times this event has been generated
is counted by isisSysManAddrDropFromAreas.
This notification is edge triggered, and should not
be regenerated until an address that was used in
the previous computation has been dropped.

event.Summary: Manual assigned IP address has dropped in Area: {$v2}

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisManualAddressDrops DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationAreaAddress s EXAMPLE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: An Area Address.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationAreaAddress

description: A notification sent when we receive a PDU
with a different value of the System ID Length.
This notification includes an index to identify
the circuit where we saw the PDU and the header of
the PDU which may help a network manager identify
the source of the confusion.
This should be an edge-triggered notification.
We should not send a second notification about
PDUs received on the same circuit.

event.Summary: Received a PDU with mismatched System ID length of {$v3}

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisIDLenMismatch DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFieldLen u 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment s EXAMPLE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: Holds the System ID length reported in PDU we received.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFieldLen

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: Holds up to 64 initial bytes of a PDU that
triggered the notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment

description: A notification sent when we receive a PDU
with a different value of the Maximum Area
Addresses. This notification includes the
header of the packet, which may help a
network manager identify the source of the
confusion.
This should be an edge-triggered notification.
We should not send a second notification about
PDUs received from the same circuit.

event.Summary: Received a PDU with an inaccurate maximum Area Address {$v3}

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisMaxAreaAddressesMismatch DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduMaxAreaAddress u 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment s EXAMPLE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: Holds the Max Area Addresses reported in a PDU
we received.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduMaxAreaAddress

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: Holds up to 64 initial bytes of a PDU that
triggered the notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment

description: A notification sent when we receive a PDU
with our systemID and zero age. This
notification includes the circuit Index
and router ID from the LSP, if available
which may help a network manager
identify the source of the confusion.

event.Summary: LS-PDU (Identifier: $v4) of zero age has purged

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisOwnLSPPurge DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId s EXAMPLEE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: An Octet String that uniquely identifies
a Link State PDU.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId

description: A notification sent when we receive a Hello
PDU from an IS which does not share any
area address. This notification includes
the header of the packet, which may help a
network manager identify the source of the
confusion.
This should be an edge-triggered notification.
We should not send a second notification about
PDUs received from the same circuit.

event.Summary: Received an invalid Hello PDU, without Area address

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisAreaMismatch DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment s EXAMPLE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: Holds up to 64 initial bytes of a PDU that
triggered the notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment

description: A notification sent when we receive a Hello
PDU from an IS, but do not establish an
adjacency for some reason.
This should be an edge-triggered notification.
We should not send a second notification about
PDUs received from the circuit.

event.Summary: Received Hello message, but Failed to establish an Adjacency

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisRejectedAdjacency DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment s EXAMPLE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: Holds up to 64 initial bytes of a PDU that
triggered the notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment

description: A notification sent when an adjacency changes
state, entering or leaving state up.
The first 6 bytes of the isisPduLspId are the
SystemID of the adjacent IS.
The isisAdjState is the new state of the adjacency.

event.Summary: Adjacency changed state to {$v5} of  LSP (ID: $v4)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisAdjacencyChange DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId s EXAMPLEE DC-ISIS-MIB::isisAdjState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationISAdjIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisISAdjNeighSNPAAddress s EXAMPLE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: An Octet String that uniquely identifies
a Link State PDU.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId

description: The current state of an adjacency.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisAdjState

description: A unique value identifying the IS adjacency from all
other such adjacencies on this circuit.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationISAdjIndex

description: The SNPA address of the neighboring system.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisISAdjNeighSNPAAddress

description: This notification is generated when we receive
an LSP with a parse error. The isisCircIfIndex
holds in index of the circuit on which the PDU
arrived. The isisPduFragment holds start of the LSP
and the isisErrorOffset points to the problem.
If the problem is a malformed TLV, isisErrorOffset
points to start of the TLV and isisErrorTLVType
holds the value of the type.
If the problem is with the LSP header, isisErrorOffset
points to the suspicious byte.
The number of such LSPs is accumulated in
isisSysStatLSPErrors.

event.Summary: Received LSP with parse error. isisErrorOffset: {$v6} and malformed TLV: {$v7}

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisLSPErrorDetected DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId s EXAMPLEE DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment s EXAMPLE DC-ISIS-MIB::isisErrorOffset u 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisErrorTLVType u 0

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: An Octet String that uniquely identifies
a Link State PDU.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: Holds up to 64 initial bytes of a PDU that
triggered the notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduFragment

description: An offset to a problem in a PDU. If the problem
is a malformed TLV, this points to the begining
of the TLV. If the problem is in the header, this
points to the byte that is suspicious.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisErrorOffset

description: The type for a malformed TLV.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisErrorTLVType

description: When the sequence number on an LSP we generate
wraps the 32-bit sequence counter, we purge and
wait to re-announce this information. This
notification describes that event. Since these
should not be generated rapidly, we generate
an event each time this happens.
While the first 6 bytes of the LSPID are ours
the other two contain useful information.

event.Summary: LSP's 32-bit sequence counter purged due to max sequence number has reached

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisAttemptToExceedMaxSequence DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId s EXAMPLEE

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The system level for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: An Octet String that uniquely identifies
a Link State PDU.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId

description: When we receive an LSP with our System ID
and different contents, we may need to reissue
the LSP with a higher sequence number.
We send this notification if we need to increase
the sequence number by more than one. If two
Intermediate Systems are configured with the same
System ID, this notification will fire.

event.Summary: Need to reissue the LSP (ID: $v4) with higher sequence number

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisSequenceNumberSkip DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId s EXAMPLEE

instance for this notification.

description: The system level for this notification.

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: An Octet String that uniquely identifies
a Link State PDU.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisPduLspId

description: A notification sent when the value of isisCircOperState for
a circuit changes to operStatusUp, operStatusDown or
operStatusActFailed.

event.Summary: Operation state of ISIS Circuit changed to $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIndTable DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircExistState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircAdminState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircOperState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircT1TimerRunning i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircLevel i 0

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: The existence state of this circuit. This object follows
the Row Status behavior. Setting the state to
'notInService' halts the generation and processing of
IS-IS protocol PDUs on this circuit. Setting the state
to destroy will also erase any configuration associated
with the circuit.
In DC-ISIS, automatic circuits from the I3 stub appear as
passive circuits with existence state 'active'. These
circuits can be configured via the MIB like manual
circuits, except that they will survive a Destroy request
with all fields reset to their automatic values.
MIB configuration overrides automatic configuration.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircExistState

description: The administrative state of the circuit. This
object follows the AdminState behavior.
In DC-ISIS the default admin state for a new automatic
circuit is 'on' if the isisSysAllowAutoI3Config field is
'true', otherwise the default admin state is 'off'.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircAdminState

description: The operational state of this circuit.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircOperState

description: Is the T1 timer running on this circuit?
This object is only valid on a circuit that is currently
running the IS-IS protocol (isisCircExtDomain is 'false'
and isisCircOperState is 'operStatusUp').
When set to 'true', this indicates that the local node is
running starting or restarting node procedures.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircT1TimerRunning

description: Indicates which type of packets will be sent and
accepted on this circuit. The values used will be
modified by the settings of isisSysType. This
object follows the replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behavior.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircLevel

description: A notification sent when the value of isisCircOperState for
a circuit not configured to run the IS-IS protocol (such as
an external, TE-only or passive circuit) changes to
operStatusUp, operStatusDown or operStatusActFailed.

event.Summary: Circuit is not configured to run the IS-IS protocol. Operational State: {$v5}

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisExtPassCircuitInd DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircExistState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircAdminState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircOperState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircLevel i 0

instance for this notification.

variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: The existence state of this circuit. This object follows
the Row Status behavior. Setting the state to
'notInService' halts the generation and processing of
IS-IS protocol PDUs on this circuit. Setting the state
to destroy will also erase any configuration associated

In DC-ISIS, automatic circuits from the I3 stub appear as
passive circuits with existence state 'active'. These
circuits can be configured via the MIB like manual

variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircExistState

description: The administrative state of the circuit. This
object follows the AdminState behavior.
In DC-ISIS the default admin state for a new automatic
circuit is 'on' if the isisSysAllowAutoI3Config field is
'true', otherwise the default admin state is 'off'.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircAdminState

description: The operational state of this circuit.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircOperState

description: Indicates which type of packets will be sent and
accepted on this circuit. The values used will be
modified by the settings of isisSysType. This
object follows the replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behavior.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircLevel

description: This notification is generated when the IS-IS system
changes operational state to operStatusUp, operStatusDown or
operStatusActFailed.

event.Summary: Operational state of IS-IS system changed to $v2

description: The unique identifier of the Integrated IS-IS
instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

description: The current operational status of this instance of the
Protocol Manager component of DC-ISIS.
Note that DC-ISIS can only activate if there is at least
one active entry in the isisManAreaAddrTable.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisSysOperStatus

description: An IS-IS instance sends this notification if a received
LSP has failed to authenticate.

event.Summary: Failed to authenticate received Hello message with neighboring system (ID -$v4)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisHelloAuthFailure DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationNeighSysID s EXAMPL

event.Summary: Topology state changed to $v3 and is operationally Up

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisAttachedStateChange DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationMtId i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationAttachedState i 1

variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationMtId

description: The current state of attachment.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationAttachedState

description: An IS-IS instance sends this notification if the DIS changes
at level 1 or level 2.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-ISIS-MIB::isisDisChange DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex i 0 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex i 9999 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationDisState i 1 DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircLevelDesIS s EXAMPLE

instance for this notification.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysInstance

variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationSysLevelIndex

description: The value of ifIndex for the interface to which this
circuit corresponds. This object cannot be modified
after creation.
In DC-ISIS this is also used as the 3-way circuit ID
on point-to-point circuits, and must equal isisCircIndex.
The default value is the same as isisCircIndex. A create
request using any other value will fail.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircIfIndex

description: The current state of the DIS.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisNotificationDisState

description: The ID of the LAN Designated Intermediate System
on this circuit at this level. If, for any reason
this system is not partaking in the relevant
Designated Intermediate System election process
then the value returned is the zero length OCTET STRING.
variables.name: DC-ISIS-MIB::isisCircLevelDesIS
